jcr:content.jcr:title: United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1995

contentheadline.headline: United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest 1995

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{ESC National Year | Year = 1995 | Country = United Kingdom | Preselection = [[A Song For Europe]] | Preselection date = 31 March 1995 | Entrant = [[Love City Groove]] | Song = Love City Groove | Final result = 10th, 76 points }} For the 1995 [[Eurovision Song Contest]], the [[United Kingdom|UK]] entered "Love City Groove", performed by [[Love City Groove]]. It received 76 points and 10th place. The voting for the UK's entry took place on March 31, 1995 in a programme hosted by [[Terry Wogan]]. After three years of having one act perform all the nominated songs the UK national round for Eurovision in 1995 reverted to a multi-artist format which remains in place as of 2011. The nominated songs and artists for the 1995 UK national round for Eurovision, with results, were as follows: *Love City Groove - [[Love City Groove]], 140,174 votes *One Gift of Love - Dear Jon, 81,359 votes *I Need You - [[Deuce (band)|Deuce]], 73,467 votes *Go for the Heart - [[Samantha Fox|Sox]], 65,436 votes *Rainbows and You - Simon Spiro, 43,299 votes *I'm Just Your Puppet on a (String!) - [[Londonbeat]], 35,434 votes *Spinning Away - Paul Harris, 19,239 votes *Then There's a Knock at the Door - Fff, 17,216 votes {{UK in Eurovision}} {{Eurovision Song Contest 1995}} {{DEFAULTSORT:United Kingdom In The Eurovision Song Contest 1995}} [[Category:United Kingdom in the Eurovision Song Contest]] [[Category:Countries in the Eurovision Song Contest 1995]] [[Category:1995 in British music|Eurovision Song Contest]]
